record.dc:title: 105BY11 Rymer, Bradley County, Tennessee. Burial 15BY166, an adult female, shows outline of pit, shell hairpin and shell beads at skull. Square 31R2. Direction SW.
record.wpa:narrative: Adult female in fair condition, extended on back with head to NW. Lay below 15BY165, apparently buried earlier and disturbed by 15BY165. Skull base up and crushed, mandible to right of skull. 1st and 2nd cervical vertebrae by left humerus. Small "unio" shell at right breast. Columella hair pins at skull and columella beads scattered under head and neck. Under right humerus a limestone pebble, unmodified 0.6' in diameter. Legs in good shape, torso more decayed.
record.wpa:comments: Observer illustration availalble on file. See also photo 104BY11.
